channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Regions - Asia
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Temporary clean air fixes make smog worse, says academic study
Senator: Duterte should be impeached
item.description: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte should be impeached after he admitted to personally killing drug suspects, one of his top critics told CNN.

item.title: China carrier conducts live-fire drill
item.description: China's only aircraft carrier group has conducted live-fire drills as tensions with neighboring Asian countries and the US escalate over the South China Sea.

item.title: Putin, Abe aim for peace over islands
item.description: Russia and Japan have agreed to closer economic ties and to work together to solve a 71-year-old dispute between the two countries over a remote island chain.

item.title: China's unsinkable aircraft carriers?
S. Korea slams 'childish' N. Korea drills
item.description: South Korea has strongly condemned North Korean military drills designed to simulate an attack on the South, a Unification Ministry spokesman told reporters in a regular briefing Monday.

item.title: Myanmar military burned villages?
item.description: Satellite images could prove that villages in Myanmar's restive Rakhine State were deliberately burned to the ground, according to Human Rights Watch.

item.title: Opinion: It's time to stop Chinese theft
item.description: By selecting Iowa Governor Terry Branstad as US Ambassador to China, President-elect Donald Trump chose a man who Chinese President Xi Jinping considers a "friend." But as a friend, Branstad will be the messenger to deliver the hard truth that the days of America bowing and scraping at China's feet are over.

item.title: Japan's $22 billion racing passion
item.description: Horse racing is one of only four sports the Japanese people can legally bet on, but its a phenomenon that's taking the nation -- and the sport -- by storm.

item.title: India is last hope for heaviest woman alive
item.description: Eman Ahmed, from Egypt, is believed to be the world's heaviest woman. According to her family, she weighs 1,102 pounds (500 kg).

item.title: Japan uses tech to track their elderly
item.description: Some people microchip their pets to ensure they're easily found when lost, but now a city in Japan wants to apply a similar approach to their elderly -- and they're turning to QR code stickers instead of microchips.

item.title: Tropical cyclone Vardah hits India
item.description: Heavy rain and winds have begun to pound the Indian city of Chennai, with a severe tropical cyclone is expected to make landfall Monday.

item.title: HK protesters cheer downfall of top official
Nepalese foods you need to try
North Korea tourist photos?
Beertopia? Asia's thriving craft brewery
item.description: Think of Beertopia as Asia's younger, smaller-scale answer to the Great American Beer Festival.

item.title: The most spectacular racecourse?
item.description: Hugh Bowman edged out Ryan Moore in a tense International Jockeys' Championship at Happy Valley racecourse, Hong Kong.

item.title: Misty mountains or mega metropolis?
item.description: Yang Yongliang's dreamy works have the familiarity of traditional Chinese paintings, but on closer inspection, his take on the country's rapid urbanization is soon revealed, in what he describes as 'digital landscapes.'

item.title: How China's President changes travel
Is Aung San Suu Kyi the Mandela of Asia?
item.description: After spending 15 years under house arrest, democracy icon Aung San Suu Kyi explains her life outlook and why she doesn't harbor bitterness.

item.title: Why can't these Indians leave Saudi Arabia?
item.description: 7,700 Indian workers are stranded in Saudi Arabia after a series of layoffs. CNN gets access to one of the 20 camps where workers are stuck.

item.title: Heineken taps into Myanmar's beer market
item.description: We look into Myanmar's brewing beer market and find out why Heineken invested in a $60 million brewery outside of Yangon.

item.title: A 'car-eating' transformer could save environment
item.description: It looks like a giant, car-eating transformer, but China is hoping this new vehicle concept will be the answer to its crippling traffic problems

item.title: Philippines elects its first transgender politician
item.description: CNN's Kristie Lu Stout speaks with Geraldine Roman, the first transgender woman in history to be elected to the Philippines congress.

item.title: Painting with shadows
item.description: In India's capital city, one wall bears an off-beat artwork that disappears after the sun goes down.

item.title: Police save girls from trafficking in Vietnam
item.description: CNN's Alexandra Field meets five 14-year-old girls saved by the Vietnamese border police as traffickers were about to take them across the border into China.

item.title: Who is Rodrigo Duterte?
item.description: He's caused outrage with inflammatory comments on rape and murder, but Philippines presidential candidate Rodrigo Duterte is poised to become its next president. CNN's Alexandra Field reports.

item.title: What Amitabh Bachchan means to India
Steve Wynn on politics and business
Who are Big Bang?
